item.title: Jeffrey R. Holland, next in line to lead Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, dies at 85
item.description: Jeffrey R. Holland led the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles, a key governing body. He was next in line to become the church's president.

item.title: Winter storm brings heavy snow and ice to busy holiday travel weekend
item.description: A powerful winter storm is impacting parts of the U.S. with major snowfall, ice, and below zero wind chills. The conditions are disrupting holiday travel and could last through next week.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: Disability rights advocate Bob Kafka dead at 79
item.description: Bob Kafka was an organizer with ADAPT (American Disabled for Attendant Programs Today), a group which advocates for policy change to support people with disabilities.

item.title: 'It's behind you!' How Britain goes wild for pantomimes during the holidays
item.description: Pantomimes are plays based on a well-known story — often a fairy tale — which are given a bawdy twist. The audience is expected to join in throughout, shouting as loudly as they can.

item.title: Kennedy Center vows to sue musician who canceled performance over Trump name change
item.description: The Kennedy Center is planning legal action after jazz musician Chuck Redd canceled an annual holiday concert. Redd pulled out after President Trump's name appeared on the building.

item.title: Russia attacks Kyiv, killing 1 and wounding many ahead of Ukraine-U.S. talks
item.description: Russia attacked Ukraine's capital with missiles and drones early Saturday morning, killing one and wounding over 20 people a day before talks between Ukraine and the U.S., local authorities said.

item.title: Myanmar is set to hold phased elections. Here's why they're being called a 'sham'
item.description: Myanmar's military rulers are holding a general election in phases starting Dec. 28 amid the country's civil war. The head of the U.N. says the vote will be anything but free and fair.
